Hi Poom

Yes, there is a lot of information and instructions in the documents I sent.  For this week, a priority would be to log into easy-speak and follow the link in the left-hand panel to the next meeting.  Once on the webpage for the Nov 25th meeting, confirm that you will be attending.  This is covered in pages 1 through 4 of the Easy-Speak Instructions document.  

Reading the rest of the Easy-Speak manual will be helpful for future meetings.  The meeting this week is our Evaluation Contest so it is a little unusual compared to our usual meeting agenda.

Please let me know if you have any other questions.  

Adrian

On Sun, Nov 21, 2021 at 9:14 PM Adrian Walton <adrian.walton@gmail.com> wrote:

Hello Poom,

 

Welcome to Rise and Shine Toastmasters Club #331!

 

Irene Schell, our Club president, has submitted your registration to Toastmasters International.  You should have received an email from Toastmasters International about your membership, accessing your account on www.toastmasters.org, and accessing Pathways.  Please let me know if you have not received this email.


Pathways : 


Pathways, in short, is the online speech/project curriculum that club members use to guide their toastmasters education.  You can learn about Pathways here - https://www.toastmasters.org/pathways-overview.  Attached to help you begin on your path choice, are following:

 

·          The Navigator – which provides an overview of Pathways

·          Paths and Core Competencies – which may be helpful in choosing your Path

·          Pathways Ice Breaker - which will be your first speech project

·          Pathways Getting Started and Quick Tips

 

easy-Speak:


You have also been registered in easy-Speak (www.easy-speak.org), which is the site that the club uses for scheduling and tracking roles for our weekly meetings.  You should have received an email from easy-Speak regarding your account and password.  Please let me know if you have not received this email.


Attached is an easy-speak manual that outlines the basics of the site.  You will see that you will be assigned for meeting roles relatively quickly – the attached manual outlines how to confirm your attendance at future meetings, sign-up for roles, etc.  

 


I will schedule you for some roles in the next few weeks in easy-Speak.  When you have had a chance to look at the Ice Breaker project (see attached) we can get that scheduled as well – maybe in December or January --- take a look at the availability on easy-Speak and let me know if you have a date that you prefer.


Also attached are documents that outline the responsibilities of the Meeting Roles and the new Online Meeting Protocols.  Note that when you are logged into easy-Speak you will see general overviews of each position – these are the standard duties for each role but our club has made some modifications so it is best to refer to the attached document.

 

If you have any questions about your assigned meeting roles, Pathways, easy-Speak, or your membership, please feel free to contact me.  And if you have any questions about Toastmasters or the club, please feel free to connect with a member of the Executive or your mentor (one will be assigned shortly).

 

Enjoy your Toastmasters journey!


 

Adrian Walton

Vice President Education

Rise and Shine Toastmasters

Club # 331, Victoria, BC

visit our website
